org.joml

Class MatrixStackf

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.joml.Matrix4f
      • org.joml.MatrixStackf
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Externalizable, Serializable, Matrix4fc

    public class MatrixStackf
extends Matrix4f
    A stack of many Matrix4f instances. This resembles the matrix stack known from legacy OpenGL.

    This MatrixStackf class inherits from Matrix4f, so the current/top matrix is always the MatrixStackf/Matrix4f itself. This affects all operations in Matrix4f that take another Matrix4f as parameter. If a MatrixStackf is used as argument to those methods, the effective argument will always be the current matrix of the matrix stack.

    Author:
    Kai Burjack
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatrixStackf

        public MatrixStackf(int stackSize)
        Create a new MatrixStackf of the given size.

        Initially the stack pointer is at zero and the current matrix is set to identity.

        Parameters:
        stackSize - the size of the stack. This must be at least 1, in which case the MatrixStackf simply only consists of this Matrix4f

      • MatrixStackf

        public MatrixStackf()
        Do not invoke manually! Only meant for serialization.

        Invoking this constructor from client code will result in an inconsistent state of the created MatrixStackf instance.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public MatrixStackf clear()
        Set the stack pointer to zero and set the current/bottom matrix to identity.
        Returns:

      • pushMatrix

        public MatrixStackf pushMatrix()
        Increment the stack pointer by one and set the values of the new current matrix to the one directly below it.
        Returns:
        this

      • popMatrix

        public MatrixStackf popMatrix()
        Decrement the stack pointer by one.

        This will effectively dispose of the current matrix.

        Returns:
        this
